results.title: Building the industrial revolution
results.creator_credit: Mick Gold and Link Film Services
results.brief_description: A film about the elements that created the factory system, the buildings that housed it, and the social changes that it generated - a story told by the industrial architecture of the East Midlands, the area in which the first factories were built.
results.description: A film about the elements that created the factory system, the buildings that housed it, and the social changes that it generated - a story told by the industrial architecture of the East Midlands, the area in which the first factories were built.

results.title: Brown coal to kilowatts
results.creator_credit: Frank Hurley and State Electricity Commission of Victoria
results.brief_description: Classroom film describing the processes by which wet, raw brown coal from the Yallourn open cut is burned in specially designed boilers to produce steam for use in turbines for the generation of electric power. Laboratory demonstration, models, and diagrams explain the principles of operation of plant seen in use at Yallourn.

results.title: Broken appointment
results.creator_credit: Willard Van Dyke, Irving Jacoby, Affiliated Film Producers and Mental Health Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of a young public health nurse to a mature realization of the importance of human contact between the professional and the patient and an understanding that emotional difficulties can interfere with physical welfare. The film describes the experience of a public health nurse who is attached to a baby health clinic. During the course of her work, the nurse helps a young mother to overcome the fears and worries associated with childbirth.

results.title: Broiling
results.brief_description: Demonstrates proper broiling procedures for meats, fish, and poultry, Shows how to mark meats, tests for doneness, turn without piercing, prevent sticking, coordinate with servers, and care for equipment.

results.title: The British monarchy
results.creator_credit: Derek Mayne, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the function of limited constitutional monarchy in the present state of the British Commonwealth and Empire. The monarchy provides continuity and unity. The idea of continuity is presented by showing the historical development of the British monarchy, and something of the constitutional function of the sovereign. The idea of unity is shown by scenes illustrating the monarch’s public duties and their position in relation to other countries of the Commonwealth and Empire.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Derek Mayne, Frank Wells, Gaumont-British Instructional and J. Arthur Rank Organisation

results.title: Briefing for health
results.brief_description: Indicates the dangers facing the female recruit when she joins the W.A.A.F. The ravages of venereal diseases are illustrated, with information on the avoidance of the disease and on measures to be taken if it is suspected that the disease has been contacted. No other credits available.

results.title: Brazing a lap joint
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Gas Welding”.
In brazing a lap joint, the film demonstrates the selection of the welding tip, and the application of flux to the join.

results.title: Braze welding
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Demonstrates the method of braze welding, a bonding process used to join similar or dissimilar metals by an alloy which has a lower melting point.

results.title: The Boy Kumasenu
results.creator_credit: John Hollingsworth, Sean Graham and Gold Coast Film Unit
results.brief_description: Dramatised documentary of a young African boy, Kumasenu, making his way unaided from the tribal world into the twentieth century. He has known no life other than that of a quiet fishing village. Wrongly accused of bringing bad luck to his people he becomes an outcast and an easy prey to the temptations of the city life of which his flash friend Agboh thinks so highly. Until helped by new friends, life for him is bewildering and dangerous.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hollingsworth, Sean Graham and Gold Coast Film Unit
